title: Printing mail the smiley will result in a misprint - the rest of the page will not be printed.
content:
If I print an email, the content after the smiley is not printed. It continues on the next page (page 2), but the rest of the content from page 1 is "gone" / result in a blank page.

I have tried forwarding to Gmail, and printing from Gmail. A smiley is printed. (This to check if the smiley could be printed, and it could, no errors when printing the smiley from chrome browser / gmail.)

I can forward the email to you so you can see if the same thing happens with you.

Sincerely Ringsted Spærfabrik A/S

Svend Tue Christensen
creator: post441

title: Screen Glitches only in Firefox browser Slows PC so much forces me to reboot
content:
Ever since a couple of Firefox updates ago (been about 2-3 weeks), Firefox will screw up and start putting pieces of the page I'm on all over my screen. It comes out of nowhere on all different sites (it has happened 6 times and all were different sites), but it usually is only once a day though tonight it happened twice within an hour. Moving the mouse all over the place makes it worse with more copies. It also slows all response from my computer to several seconds no matter what I try (closing the browser, opening task manager, etc). Sometimes I can get to the reboot screen and do it there, but most of the time everything is so slow I have to hit the power button on my HP which is the standby or sleep button so when I hit it again, I am at the login screen and can reboot there.

As I said, a single reboot normally solves the problem for the rest of the day or several days until tonight. I have a basic wired scroll mouse that I'm wondering if pressing down on it is causing Firefox to glitch. Otherwise, I've got no idea. Firefox has updated to 119, Windows 11 has updated a couple of times, my NVIDIA GeForce card driver updates weekly. I have no malware or viruses on my PC. Nothing is pulling hard on my resources as it only pulls 40% of my memory max when checking it in Task Manager when I can get it to open.
creator: scott_smart2000

title: Tab synchronization
content:
I usually open many tabs (hundreds) on my Firefox. Having the startup sat on "open previous windows and tabs," I keep most of them unloaded till I need them to save some memory.

Now, I need to know whether all this tabs, specially the unloaded ones, would have shown on another device after synchronization or not as I'm going to purchase another laptop and get rid of this one.

Thanks for your support.
creator: yousefzadeh62

title: foe helper won't install
content:
foe helper won't install; i was using the last version; the new window for the Halloween event didn't show up; no update available; i uninstalled/reinstalled to get from v3.2.9.0 to v3.3; it added but doesn't work; either fix the new version or give me back the old version;

and don't say contact helper:

The new version is uploaded but not released by mozilla... Please be patient.

by the way helper won't reinstall at all ... Chrome has already released the version although both were submitted almost simultaneously. In an emergency, you can use Chrome for a few days. github.com/mainIine/foe-helfer-extension/issues/2693
creator: jimmyolson2064

title: Closed Youtube video continues to play in the background
content:
I read an email on gmail in a Firefox tab. It contained a youtube video that I played. I closed the tab iwithout exiting youtube. Now the sound of the video plays constantly in the background.

I closed and reopened Firefox, but the videos sound still continues to play.

How do I kill this process?
creator: vince21

title: page setup
content:
Where is the page setup option? Firefox used to be simple. Using the page setup feature, one could specify the contents and locations of the headers and footers. It is especially useful for showing the website and date of the webpage to be printed.

The page setup feature is not there. It is nowhere.

I am not going to use about:config to try to get the page setup feature.

PLEASE RESTORE THE "PAGE SETUP" FUNCTION.
creator: ifreed1

title: windows taskbar doesn't disappear in firefox fullscreen
content:
When I go into fullscreen, by any means (F11 or dedicated button next to zoom settings), only the firefox toolbar disappears. The window taskbar stays there. Issue is not present on other installed browsers.

I tried: - Troubleshoot mode - Tinkering with windows accessibility settings for Firefox - On troubleshoot mode, Individually flipping these configs (+ refresh): - - browser.fullscreen.autohide - - browser.link.open_newwindow.disabled_in_fullscreen - - browser.link.open_newwindow.disabled_in_fullscreen - - widget.windows.fullscreen_remind_taskbar
creator: heitorprimeiro

title: navegador inutil
content:
se instala el navegador firefox o se actualiza, uno espera navegar urgentemente, y aparece ERROR problema al cargar la pàgina https://support.mozilla.org/es/questions/new/desktop/form La conexión ha caducado

Ha ocurrido un error al conectar con www.google.com.

Si su equipo o red están protegidos por un cortafuegos o proxy, asegúrese de que Firefox tiene permiso para acceder a la web.

title: User Interface
content: FIrefox previously would list my favorite quick reference tabs in any open window. Now I have to open a new window or tab to get this option. Classic example of upgrades removing convenient features. Is this a setting that I cannot find?
